sentences.chinese: 基因检测公司对此却不敢苟同。

sentences.english: A:I'm afraid I can't agree with you on that.
That says but among them about that the native place succeeding is Nan Yang City, the author begs to differ.
sentences.chinese: 但其中关于张继籍贯南阳之说，笔者不敢苟同。

sentences.english: While I understand your point of view，I do not share it.
sentences.chinese: 我虽了解你的观点，但不敢苟同。

sentences.english: Two senior Senators on the Armed Services Committee beg to differ.
sentences.chinese: 军事上的两个委员会的资深参议员不敢苟同。

sentences.english: Other news organizations that have tackled such stories would disagree.
sentences.chinese: 其它做过此类节目的新闻组织恐怕不敢苟同。

sentences.english: I beg to differ with you, Mr Morison.
sentences.chinese: 恕我不敢苟同，莫里森先生。

sentences.english: This psychological approach to the problems of history is not one which the writer finds very useful.
sentences.chinese: 笔者不敢苟同这种从心理学角度分析历史问题的方法。

sentences.english: These objections aside, this is a masterly book.
sentences.chinese: 除去这些不敢苟同的地方，这是一本精湛的书。

sentences.english: I disagree with you on boths.
sentences.chinese: 我对你的两个观点均不敢苟同。

sentences.english: With all due respect, i have to disagree with your conclusions.
sentences.chinese: 尽管对您推崇备至，但我还是对您的结论不敢苟同。

sentences.english: While I understand your point of view, I do not share it.
sentences.chinese: 我虽了解你的观点，但不敢苟同。

definition: to snort disdainfully/to scoff at/to turn up one's nose
irreproachable (idiom)/nothing blameworthy about it at all
see 未可厚非[wei4 ke3 hou4 fei1]
to approve of/to endorse/(vote) in favor
to approve of/to endorse/(vote) in favor
to revere the past and neglect the present (idiom)
The benevolent sees benevolence, the wise sees wisdom./Different views are admissible. (idiom)
pinyin: ren2 zhe3 jian4 ren2 , zhi4 zhe3 jian4 zhi4
